\begin{abstract}
We consider quantum cryptographic schemes where the carriers of
information are 3-state particles. One protocol uses four mutually
unbiased bases and appears to provide better security than
obtainable with 2-state carriers. Another possible method allows quantum
states to belong to more  than one basis. The security is not better,
but many curious features arise. \end{abstract}
